examples: twenty of the therapists were Caucasian, two were African American, and two were Hispanic

adjective.description: Relating to a group of languages spoken in the region of the Caucasus, of which thirty-eight are known, many not committed to writing. The most widely spoken is Georgian, of the small South Caucasian family, not related to the three North Caucasian families.

noun.description: A white person; a person of European origin.
examples: the man is described as being a 50-year-old Caucasian with a full head of graying hair
